title: How to Heat Milk Without Scalding

steps.headline: To heat milk for a recipe or for child/adult consumption, use a small stove top pot.
steps.description: There are proper milk saucepans which you can purchase if you wish.

steps.headline: Heat low.
steps.description: If milk gets too hot, it bubbles over before you even know it has happened. Use a low heat and keep your eye on it.

steps.headline: Heat slow.
steps.description: Exercise patience. Ignore the temptation to raise the heat to cook it faster. Stir it continuously to avoid solids sticking to the bottom and burning.

steps.headline: Test the temperature.
steps.description: Make sure it's warm, but not so hot it will burn your mouth. Use a teaspoon to collect some milk from the pot, hold your wrist over the spoon to check the temperature, and if it isn't ridiculously hot, give it a taste.

steps.headline: To heat milk for infant consumption, put the milk in a sterile bottle.
steps.description: Heat the bottle in a pot of water, the microwave (if the bottle is microwave safe), or in a bottle warmer.
